events.event_description: U.S. refinery capacity increased by 2% (324,000 barrels per day) in 2023.
events.citation: Operable atmospheric crude oil distillation capacity, our primary measure of refinery capacity in the United States, increased by 2%, or 324,000 barrels per day (b/d), in 2023, according to our recently published Refinery Capacity Report.

events.event_description: ExxonMobil completed a 240,000-b/d expansion project at its Beaumont refinery in Texas, bringing the refinery's capacity to 609,000 b/d.
events.citation: Much of the increase in U.S. refining capacity in 2023 was due to a 240,000-b/d expansion project at ExxonMobil's Beaumont refinery in Texas, which brought the refinery's capacity to 609,000 b/d.

events.event_description: U.S. refinery capacity reached a record high of 19.0 million b/d.
events.citation: The 2% increase marks the second consecutive year of U.S. refinery capacity growth, but the 18.4 million-b/d capacity as of the beginning of 2024 remained slightly less than the record on January 1, 2020, of 19.0 million b/d.

events.event_description: U.S. idle refinery capacity reached an all-time low with no facilities reported completely idle.
events.citation: Idle U.S. refinery capacity was at an all-time low at the beginning of the year, and no facilities were reported completely idle for the second time since 2018.
